Build a complete JavaScript web scraper for https://www.honolulu.gov/clerk/clk-council-calendar/

Extract these fields: time, date, name, name-note, agenda_url, docket_url

COMPLETE workflow (do ALL steps):
1. Use execute_code to fetch HTML and examine structure
2. Find working CSS selectors for each field
3. Build complete scraper using module.exports = async function(url) {...}
4. Use execute_code to TEST the scraper - must return actual data
5. If fields are null, fix selectors and test again
6. Return final working code

CRITICAL: Use JavaScript, require(), cheerio/axios. Test until it extracts real data!

âš ï¸ PREVIOUS ATTEMPT FAILED
Attempt #2 returned incomplete code or didn't call test_scraper.

Last code generated:
```javascript
{"name": "test_scraper", "parameters": {"code": "module.exports = async function(url) {\n  const axios = require('axios');\n  const cheerio = require('cheerio');\n\n  const { data } = await axios.get(url);\n  const $ = cheerio.load(data);\n\n  const results = [];\n\n  $('tr').each((i, el) => {\n    const time = $(el).find('.time').text().trim();\n    const date = $(el).find('.date').text().trim();\n    const name = $(el).find('.name').text().trim();\n    const nameNote = $(el).find('.name-note').text().trim();\n    const agendaUrl = $(el).find('a[href]').attr('href');\n    const docketUrl = $(el).find('a[href]').attr('href');\n\n    results.push({\n      time,\n      date,\n      name,\n      nameNote,\n      agenda_url: agendaUrl,\n      docket_url: docketUrl\n    });\n  });\n\n  console.log(JSON.stringify(results, null, 2));\n  return results;\n};", "targetUrl": "https://www.honolulu.gov/clerk/clk-council-calendar/", "fieldsRequired": ["time","date","name","name-note","agenda_url","docket_url"]}}
```

You MUST:
1. Build complete scraper with module.exports
2. Call test_scraper to validate
3. Fix any validation errors
4. Do NOT return code without testing it first!
